Name: G.SMIM.19
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: (Guideline) Min./Max. MIM_L_MK width. Note: 1. MIM_L_MK is to identify the Fusetop2 (Stack MIM) Length side for LVS purpose. 2. Only one side of Fusetop2 length (L) require to add MIM_L_MK. Then adjacent side is autoidentified as width (W) of Fusetop2.

Name: G.SMIM.20
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]

Name: G.SMIM.21
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: (Guideline) MIM_L_MK must extend to complete length of FuseTop2. Min./Max. MIM_L_MK space to FuseTop2 width (W) sides.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: G.TLA.1
Description: For any MV PCOMP inside ((DNWELL NOT LVPWELL) OR Nwell) with any edge >= 20 um and within 3 um of any MVNCOMP (((outside Nwell) AND (inside LVPWELL)) OR Psub) with any edge >= 10 um shall have Nwell/DNWELL tap in between MV PCOMP and MV NCOMP with distance within.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->Transient Latch-up Related Guidelines

Name: G.TLA.2
Description: For any MVNCOMP (((outside Nwell) AND (inside LVPWELL)) OR Psub) with any edge >= 10 um and within 3 um of any MVPCOMP inside ((DNWELL NOT LVPWELL) OR Nwell) with any edge >= 20 um shall have LVPWELL/Psub tap in between MV NCOMP and MV PCOMP with distance within.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->Transient Latch-up Related Guidelines

Name: G.Vn.4c
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Min. Metal [n+1] enclose Vian on all sides for min. Vian resistance variation [Outside Not Allowed] (Guideline).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Vian Design Rules (where n = 1 to 5)

Name: GMBT.1
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Use cross-coupled or interleave kind of layout style as shown in the sample layout schemes - MOS transistor case. Please refer to the transistor mismatch characterization report for expected mismatch, etc.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Illustrations of Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines

Name: GMBT.2
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Metal connection width and lengths to each identical node of the matched pair transistors shall be identical and symmetrical.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Illustrations of Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines

Name: GMBT.3
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: If the transistors are required to be matched in the ratio of "1:X" (X may be 2, 4, 8... 24, etc.) ratio, then the identical layout units shall be used to meet the ratio (use one unit to "x" identical units in parallel ratio) rather than creating a ratio by selecting one finger with multiple fingers or smaller "AE" transistors with single "X*AE" width transistor (AE is the emitter area).
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Illustrations of Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines

Name: GMBT.4
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: If BJT devices are available with isolated collector (not substrate collector), then use those rather than common collector for band gap reference to avoid any substrate noise effect.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Illustrations of Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines

Name: GMBT.5
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Vertical BJTs are preferred over the lateral BJTs for band gap reference to minimize the effect of lithography variation.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Illustrations of Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines

Name: GMBT.6
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Rectangular shape of emitter layout shall be preferred over the square shape as rectangular shape BJT will have lower base resistance.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP) - Guidelines

If it is really needed to do so then those resistors must be surrounded by a substrate guard ring to avoid and asymmetrical. Name: HRES.12b_HV
Description: Min. Poly2 to guard ring space. All High Voltage Poly2 resistors should be directly surrounded by well or substrate guard ring (for inside DVNWELL, shall be NCOMP guard ring, for outside DVNWELL, shall be PCOMP guard ring) and tied to the respective well or substrate potential. The following layers are not allowed between Poly2 resistor and guard ring: ((Nwell OR ndif) OUTSIDE DVNWELL), gate, IND_MK, FuseTop, HVNDDD, HVPDDD.

RES_MK length shall coincide with resistor length (defined by Pplus space) and width covering the width of Poly2. Name: IO.1
Description: For LV and MV outside DNWELL. (a1) NCOMP in LVPWELL/ PSub directly connected to I/O pad must be surrounded by LVPWELL/Psub tap inside the LVPWELL/Psub without any PCOMP in NWELL in between (exclude the case when each NMOS transistor has full width butting to well tap). (a2) It should also be directly surrounded by an Nwell guard ring (non-broken NCOMP ring inside Nwell) outside the LVPWELL. Nwell guard ring shall be connected to the most positive supply. Max. space of Nwell guard ring to the NCOMP in LVPWELL/Psub directly connected to I/O pad <= 15. (b) Within 15 um from the edge of the NCOMP connected to I/O pad (marked by Latchup_MK): max. Nwell/DNWELL tap distance to PCOMP inside Nwell/DNWELL (irrespective of its direct connection to Pad) == 2.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Name: IO.2
Description: For LV and MV outside DNWELL. Minimum recommended Nwell guard ring width: Maximize contact to guard uniformly. As a guideline, ratio of total contact area to the active area of the guard ring should be more than 5%.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Name: IO.3
Description: For LV and MV outside DNWELL. (a1) PCOMP in Nwell directly connected to I/O pad must be surrounded by Nwell tap inside the Nwell (exclude the case when each PMOS transistor has full width butting to well tap). (a2) It should also be directly surrounded by PCOMP guard ring outside Nwell. PCOMP guard ring shall be connected to the lowest potential. Max. space of guard ring PCOMP to the PCOMP in Nwell directly connected to the I/O pad <= 15. (b) Within 10 um from the edge of the PCOMP connected to I/O Pad (marked by Latchup_MK): max. P substrate/LVPWELL tap distance to NCOMP outside Nwell (irrespective of its direct connection to Pad) <= 5.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Name: IO.4
Description: For LV and MV outside DNWELL. Minimum recommended PCOMP guard ring width: maximize contact to guard uniformly. As a guideline, ratio of total contact area to the active area of the guard ring should be more than 5%.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Name: IO.5
Description: For LV and MV inside DNWELL. (a1) NCOMP in LVPWELL directly connected to I/O pad must be surrounded by LVPWELL well tap inside the LVPWELL (exclude the case when each NMOS transistor has full width butting to well tap). Below IO.5 (a2), IO.5 (b), IO.6 only check when there is latch-up formation within the same DNWELL, implying the case when there exists PCOMP outside the LVPWELL (which enclosed the NCOMP connected to I/O pad) and inside the same DNWELL. (a2) It should also be directly surrounded by an NCOMP guard ring outside LVPWELL NCOMP guard ring shall be connected to the most positive supply. Max. space of guarding NCOMP to the NCOMP in LVPWELL directly connected to the I/O pad <= 15. (b) Then within 10 um from the edge of the NCOMP connected to I/O Pad (marked by Latchup_MK): max. Nwell/DNWELL tap distance to PCOMP outside LVPWELL (irrespective of its direct connection to Pad) <= 5.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Name: IO.6
Description: For LV and MV inside DNWELL. Minimum recommended NCOMP width: maximize contact to guard uniformly. As a guideline, ratio of total contact area to the active area of the guard ring should be more than 5%.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Name: IO.7
Description: For LV and MV inside DNWELL. (a1) PCOMP in Nwell/DNWELL directly connected to I/O pad must be surrounded by Nwell/DNWELL tap inside the DNWELL without any NCOMP in LVPWELL in between (exclude when each PMOS transistor has full width butting to well tap). Below IO.7 (a2), IO.7 (b), IO.8 only check when there is latch-up formation within the same DNWELL, implying that there exists NCOMP inside LVPWELL within the same DNWELL. (a2) It should also be directly surrounded by LVPWELL guard ring (non-broken PCOMP ring inside LVPWELL) outside Nwell/DNWELL tab. LVPWELL guard ring shall be connected to the lowest potential. Max. space of LVPWELL guard ring to the PCOMP directly connected to I/O pad <= 15. (b) Within 10 um from the edge of the PCOMP connected to I/O Pad (marked by Latchup_MK): max. LVPWELL tab distance to NCOMP inside LVPWELL (irrespective of its direct connection to Pad) <= 5.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Name: IO.8
Description: For LV and MV inside DNWELL. Minimum recommended LVPWELL guard ring width: maximize contact to guard uniformly. As a guideline, ratio of total contact area to the active area of the guard ring should be more than 5%.
Table Title: I/O Latch-up for LV and MV Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->I/O Latch-up Related Design Rules and Guidelines

Description: Min. Poly2 on field space to COMP [unrelated]. Min. Poly2 on field space to guard ring. (i) Outside Low Rdson device is not checked. (ii) Inside Low Rdson device (HV device with MV GOX) >= 0.2.

Name: LRES.11

Name: LRES.9b_HV
Description: Min. Poly2 to guard ring space. All High Voltage Poly2 resistors should be directly surrounded by well or substrate guard ring (for inside DVNWELL, shall be NCOMP guard ring, for outside DVNWELL, shall be PCOMP guard ring) and tied to the respective well or substrate potential. The following layers are not allowed between Poly2 resistor and guard ring: ((Nwell OR ndif) OUTSIDE DVNWELL), gate, IND_MK, FuseTop, HVNDDD, HVPDDD.

Name: LU.5
Description: For Native V  t   NMOS (check for NAT marking). For within 50 um from NAT layer, if there is DNWELL, or NWELL present, then NAT layer shall be directly surrounded by PCOMP substrate guard ring (no other NCOMP, NWELL, HVNDDD, HVPDDD, DNWELL in between the NAT and PCOMP guard ring).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->Latch-up Design Rules and Guidelines->Core Latch-up Common Design Rules

Name: LU.6
Description: For Native V  t   PMOS. For within 50 um from NAT of Native Vt PMOS layer, if there is LVPWELL and NCOMP present inside same DNWELL, then NAT layer shall be directly surrounded by NCOMP DNWELL guard ring (no other NCOMP, PCOMP, NWELL, HVNDDD, HVPDDD in between the NAT and NCOMP guard ring).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Reliability Guidelines->Latch-up Design Rules and Guidelines->Core Latch-up Common Design Rules

Name: M1.1
Description: Min. METAL1 width.

Name: M1.2a
Description: Min. METAL1 space.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->METALn Design Rules (where n = 1 to 5)

Name: MBT.1
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Each pair of BJT transistors which is expected to be a matched pair must be marked with a separate polygon of "MATCHED_MK".
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.10
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: There shall not be any unrelated (unrelated implies the metal not connected to these transistors) metal routing about either of the matched pair BJT transistors.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.11
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Matched pair BJT transistors shall not be separated by any unrelated devices in between.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.12
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Matched pair BJT transistor's Base and Collector COMP also have to be identical in shape and equal in area.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.2
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Emitter (COMP AND LVS_BJT) width of all BJT transistors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon must be the same.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.3
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Minimum emitter (COMP AND LVS_BJT) width of BJT transistors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon is as per min. DR of that tech.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.4
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Emitter length of all BJT transistors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon must be the same.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.5
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Minimum emitter area (emitter length*width) of either of the two BJT transistors drawn for matched pair shall be greater than: Note: This is based on the expected typical percent mismatch standard deviation (Ïƒ Î” Vbe <= 1 mV). NPN >= 1.0 sq um; PNP >= 0.8 sq um.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.6
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Orientation of all BJT transistors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon must be in the same direction.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.7
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Maximum distance between two BJT transistors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon. Note: They shall be placed as close as possible while not violating minimal spacing rules; this rule is just to prevent worst case scenarios.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.8
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: One polygon of "MATCHED_MK" can only enclose either NPN transistors or PNP transistors. Both type of transistors (NPN and PNP) cannot be enclosed by a single "MATCHED_MK" polygon.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MBT.9
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Matched pair BJT transistors shall have at least one row of dummy MOS transistors (not used in circuit connection) surrounding the matched pair.
Table Title: Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair BJT Transistor Design Rules (NPN or PNP)

Name: MC.1

Name: MC.10

Name: MC.2
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]

Name: MC.3
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]

Name: MC.4
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]

Name: MC.5
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Minimum area (length*width) of either of the two capacitors drawn for matched pair shall be greater than: Note: This is based on the expected typical percent mismatch standard deviation ((Ïƒ Î” C/C) % <= 0.5%). If higher mismatch can be tolerated, then the area can be smaller. For ~1 fF/sq um >= 20 um^2. For ~2.0 fF/sq um >= 25 um^2.
Table Title: Matched Pair MIM/MOM Capacitor Design Rules
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Matched Pair MIM/MOM Capacitor Design Rules

Name: MC.6
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]

Name: MC.7
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Maximum distance between two MIM/MOM capacitors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon. Note: They shall be placed as close as possible while not violating minimal spacing rules; this rule is just to prevent worst case scenarios.
Table Title: Matched Pair MIM/MOM Capacitor Design Rules

Name: MC.8
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: MIM/MOM capacitors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon cannot be crossing or touching two different wells. In other words, they must be enclosed by same wells or "no well at all". Note: Well here implies: "DNWELL OR HVNWELL OR PWHV or Nwell or Pfield or NW1A or PF1VA.

Name: MC.9
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]

Name: MMT.10
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]

Name: MMT.12

Name: MMT.5a
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Minimum area (channel length*width) of either of the two NMOS transistors drawn for matched pair shall be greater than: Note: This is based on the expected typical percent mismatch standard deviation ((Ïƒ Î” Ids/Ids% ) <= 1.0%). Thin NMOS >= 4.0 (20-30Ã…); Thick NMOS >= 5.0 (50-120Ã…).

Name: MMT.5b

Thin PMOS >= 2.5 (20-30Ã…); Thick PMOS >= 2.5; (50-120Ã…).

Name: MMT.6

Name: MMT.7
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: Maximum distance between two MOS transistors enclosed by a given "MATCHED_MK" polygon. Note: They shall be placed as close as possible while not violating minimal spacing rules, this rule is just to prevent worst case scenarios.

Name: MSLOT.9a

Name: MSLOT.9b
Notes: [NOTE: Top Metal is the last Metal of the product. For example, for 4-layer metal product, Top Metal is Metal4.]
Description: No slotting allowed for the following cases: (b) MIM bottom plate directly under FuseTop (for MIM option-A process). MIM bottom plate directly under FuseTop (for MIM option-B process). MIM bottom plate directly under FuseTop2 (for stack MIM option process). Bottom plate directly under FuseTop (for TaN resistor option-A process). Bottom plate directly under TANRES (for TaN resistor option-B process). Minimum distance to these layers.

Name: MSLOT.9c
Notes: [NOTE: Top Metal is the last Metal of the product. For example, for 4-layer metal product, Top Metal is Metal4.]

Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Metal Slotting Design Rules

Name: MSLOT.9d
Notes: [NOTE: Top Metal is the last Metal of the product. For example, for 4-layer metal product, Top Metal is Metal4.]
Description: No slotting allowed for the following cases: (d) MetalTop slots are not allowed to interact with top via in FuseTop area (for MIM option-B process). MetalTop slots are not allowed to interact with top via in FuseTop2 area (for stack MIM option process). Minimum distance to these layers.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Metal Slotting Design Rules

Name: MSLOT.9e
Notes: [NOTE: Top Metal is the last Metal of the product. For example, for 4-layer metal product, Top Metal is Metal4.]

Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.12
Description: Overlap with P-channel Poly2 gate extension is forbidden within 0.32 um of P-channel gate.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.2
Description: Min. Nplus space. Merge if the space is less than 0.4 um.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.3a
Description: Min. Nplus space to PCOMP for PCOMP: (1) Inside Nwell. (2) Outside LVPWELL but inside DNWELL. (i) Outside Low Rdson device >= 0.16. (ii) Inside Low Rdson device >= 0.14.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.3b
Description: Min. Nplus space to PCOMP: for inside DNWELL: (i) For LVPWELL enclose PCOMP < 0.43 um, >= 0.16. (ii) For LVPWELL enclose PCOMP >= 0.43 um, >= 0.08.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.3c
Description: Min. Nplus space to PCOMP: for outside DNWELL: (i) For PCOMP space to Nwell < 0.43 um, >= 0.16. (ii) For PCOMP space to Nwell >= 0.43 um, >= 0.08.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.3d
Description: Min./Max. Nplus overlap of Pplus.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.3e
Description: Min. Nplus space to related PCOMP edge adjacent to a butting edge.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.4a
Description: Min. Nplus space to related P-channel gate at a butting edge parallel to gate.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.4b
Description: Within 0.32 um of channel, space to P-channel gate extension perpendicular to the direction of Poly2.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.5a
Description: Min. Nplus extend beyond COMP under N-channel gate.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.5b
Description: Min. Nplus extension beyond COMP for the COMP. (1) Inside LVPWELL. (2) Outside Nwell and DNWELL. (i) Outside Low Rdson device >= 0.16. (ii) Inside Low Rdson device >= 0.14.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.5c
Description: Min. Nplus extend beyond COMP: for inside DNWELL: (i) For Nplus < 0.43 um from LVPWELL edge for Nwell tap inside DNWELL >= 0.16. (ii) For Nplus >= 0.43 um from LVPWELL edge for Nwell tap inside DNWELL >= 0.02.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.5d
Description: Min. Nplus extend beyond COMP: for outside DNWELL: (i) For Nwell enclose Nplus < 0.43 um (outside ULR PMOS) >= 0.16. (ii) For Nwell enclose Nplus >= 0.43 um, >= 0.02. (iii) For Nwell enclose Nplus < 0.43 um (inside ULR PMOS) >= 0.14.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.6
Description: Min. NCOMP extension beyond NCOMP/PCOMP butted edge.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Name: NP.7
Description: Min. Nplus space to unsalicided Poly2 [unrelated].
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Nplus Implant Design Rules

Description: Min. Nplus hole (um^2).

Name: NP.9

Name: PRES.9b_HV

Name: QUBM.2
Description: Min. UBM enclosure by chip edge (chip edge: edge of the seal ring closest to the scribe line), include seal ring (16 um) and keep-out (10 um). Please refer to Illustration of QUBM.2 QUBM.3 QUBM.6. Edge zone is defined as 200 um from the outer edge of the seal ring. Any UBM overlapped by the edge zone will be checked by this rule.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Wafer Level Package (WLP)->Cu_PPI Design Guidelines for 4-Layer WLP Process->UBM Design Rules

Name: QUBM.3
Description: Max. UBM enclosure by chip edge (chip edge: edge of the seal ring closest to the scribe line), include seal ring (16 um) and keep-out (10 um). Please refer to Illustration of QUBM.2 QUBM.3 QUBM.6. This rule only applies to the outer-most UBM of each side/edge. Edge zone is defined as 200 um from the outer edge of the seal ring. Any UBM overlapped by the edge zone will be checked by this rule. If at least one point on the UBM polygon is within 180 um of the chip edge, it is considered to meet this rule.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Wafer Level Package (WLP)->Cu_PPI Design Guidelines for 4-Layer WLP Process->UBM Design Rules

It can only exist on CMOS transistors marked by LVS_IO, OTP_MK, ELMD_MK, ELMD2_MK, DNI, (MVSD and HVNDDD), Low Rdson NMOS and EDPMOS transistors defined in 12.3.3 and ESD_HBM_MK layers.

Name: SMIM.10a
Description: Minimum FuseTop area >= 5x5 (um^2).

Name: SMIM.10b
Description: Minimum FuseTop2 area >= 5x5 (um^2).

Name: SMIM.11a
Description: Maximum FuseTop area >= 100x100 (um^2).

Description: Maximum FuseTop2 area >= 100x100 (um^2).

Name: SMIM.13
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: 1st MIM: Top plate under Top Metal must use FuseTop layer (L92).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: SMIM.14
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: 2nd MIM: Top plate under (Top Metal-1) must use FuseTop2 (L8H).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: SMIM.15
Notes: [NOTE: 2nd MIM bottom plate is defined as: ((FuseTop2 at 1.06) AND (MetalTop-2 interact FuseTop2)).]
Description: For RF MIM (with LVS_RF), 2nd MIM bottom plate must be placed completely on top of Nwell, PField, Psub. Partially inside Nwell, PField, Psub is not allowed. [Concern of substrate terminal in RF model].
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: SMIM.16
Description: 2nd MIM bottom plate (MetalTop-2 INTERACT FuseTop2) cannot be connected to ViaTop-2 (for example, there can't be any Via1 directly under the 2nd MIM bottom plate for 4LM process).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: SMIM.17
Description: 1st MIM bottom plate (MetalTop-1 INTERACT FuseTop) cannot be connected to ViaTop-1 (for example, there can't be any Via2 directly under the 1st MIM bottom plate for 4LM process).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: SMIM.18
Notes: [NOTE: This rule is NOT checked by DRC.]
Description: FuseTop and FuseTop2 must be the same size (W and L).
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: SMIM.1a
Notes: [NOTE: 1st MIM bottom plate is defined as: ((FuseTop at 1.06) AND (MetalTop-1 interact FuseTop)).]
Description: Minimum 1st MIM bottom plate spacing to the MetalTop-1 which could be 1st MIM bottom plate or routing metal.
Chapter/Topic Full Path: Physical Design Rules->Stack MIM Capacitor Design Rules (Optional)

Name: SMIM.1b
Notes: [NOTE: 2nd MIM bottom plate is defined as: ((FuseTop2 at 1.06) AND (MetalTop-2 interact FuseTop2)).]
Description: Minimum 2nd MIM bottom plate spacing to the MetalTop-2 which could be 2nd MIM bottom plate or routing metal at same metal level.

Name: SMIM.2a
